simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
&bibtex; reads the top-level auxiliary (.aux) file that was output during the running of &latex; or &tex; and creates a bibliography (.bbl) file that will be
.bbl (bibliography file)
incorporated into the document on subsequent runs of &LaTeX; or &TeX;.
bibliography creation
The auxname on the command-line must be given without the .aux extension. If you don't
.aux (auxiliary file)
give the auxname, the program prompts you for it.

&bibtex; looks up, in bibliographic database
.bib (bibliographic database)
(.bib) files specified by the \bibliography command, the entries specified by the \cite and \nocite commands in the &LaTeX; or &TeX; source file. It formats the information from those entries according to instructions in a bibliography style (.bst) file
.bst (bibliography style file)
(specified by the \bibliographystyle command, and it outputs the results to the .bbl
.bbl
file.

The &LaTeX; reference manual explains what a &LaTeX; source file must contain to work with &bibtex;. Appendix B of the manual describes the format of the .bib files. The &BibTeX;ing document describes extensions and details of this format, and it gives other useful hints for using &bibtex;.
